Data analytics and decision-making are two rapidly growing fields that are concerned with developing techniques to assist managers in making intelligent use of stored massive data. Successful applications include customer segmentation and classification, profile analysis, cross-selling, churn analysis, credit scoring, fraud detection, etc.
In this course, students will be able to view data analytics and decision-making as the discovery of interesting patterns in data that can be used to describe or summarize the data and to predict future instances of the data. Such patterns are considered to be knowledge discovered and important for strategic decisions. Students will also be guided to build different data analytic tools such as ChatGPT to mine and analyse real data sets, such as financial data or retail data for decision-making.

Professor
Wu Yuan
holds a Masterâ€™s degree in Applied Statistics, a Masterâ€™s degree in Actuarial Studies, and a Ph.D. in Statistics from the University of New South Wales, Australia. He joined the Nanyang Business School of Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in 1994, after previously teaching at the School of Mathematics and Statistics at the University of Sydney. From 2008 to 2012, he served as the Associate Director of the Nanyang MBA Programme; from 2010 to 2014, he was the Deputy Head of the Division of Banking and Finance; and from 2016 to 2022, he served as the Programme Director of the MSc (Financial Engineering) Programme. Since 2016, Professor Wu has also been the Programme Director of the Chinese EMBA (Nanyang-Jiao Tong) Programme at Nanyang Business School.
Professor Wu teaches a wide range of courses, including Data Science and Decision Making, Risk Management and Insurance, Financial Time Series Modelling, Actuarial Asset Valuation, Linear Models in Finance, Business Data Mining, Social Research Methods, and Multivariate Statistical Analysis with Applications in Finance. His primary research interests include actuarial science and insurance, big data and data mining, and statistical applications in finance.
Professor Wu has received numerous teaching awards, including the Nanyang Business School Teacher of the Year Award (1999); the Best Teacher Award for the Actuarial Programme (1998, 1999, 2001); the Best Teacher Award for the MSc in Financial Engineering Programme (2002, 2004, 2010, 2013, 2018, 2023); the Best Teacher Award for the MSc in Finance Programme (2016, 2019, 2022); and the Best Teacher Award of the Banking and Finance Division (2017). The Nanyang Education Award is the Universityâ€™s highest honour for teaching excellence. Professor Wu received the Nanyang Education Award (School) in 2019 and the Nanyang Education Award (College) in 2020. In 2019, he was also awarded the Long Service Medal as part of Singaporeâ€™s National Day Awards.

The NTU-IMBA is a part-time programme.

Quality Assurance
: AACSB accreditation is a signal of high-quality standards in business education.
Comprehensive Evaluation
: Accreditation involves a thorough evaluation of a business school's teaching, faculty, services, and student quality. This comprehensive review ensures that the institution meets global standards of excellenceâ€‹â€‹.
Continuous Improvement
: Accredited schools are committed to continuous improvement. They regularly undergo evaluations and reviews to maintain their accreditation status. This ensures that the school remains up to date with the latest developments in business education and maintains a high standard of quality.
Global Recognition
: AACSB and EQUIS are recognized worldwide. If you plan to pursue a career in business or work internationally, having a degree from an accredited business school can enhance your credibility and marketability. Employers and organizations often value graduates from accredited institutions because they know that these graduates have received a comprehensive and reputable education.

scholarships-grant-and-subsidy.content:
We encourage early application, as scholarships and financial support are given on a rolling basis and competition is keen.
Scholarships
Eligibility criteria for scholarships application:
Candidates who are offered admission into the AY2026 intake of IMBA programme.
Additional essays and interviews are required and will be used as part of the assessment for the scholarship award.
Candidates are allowed to apply for more than one scholarship. However, only one scholarship may be awarded to the candidate. The awarded amount is

.
Stipend Support
EligibilityÂ criteria for stipend application:
CandidatesÂ residing 100km or more from Ho Chi Minh City are eligible to apply.
Candidates need to be residents of Vietnam.
Submission of proof of registered address of residence is required.
The stipend is to support these candidates with expenses for transport and accommodation to attend the in-class sessions in Ho Chi Minh City.
Candidates will need to submit an estimated breakdown of their transportation and accommodation expenses for attending the in-class sessions. This estimate should be provided along with their application for stipend support.

previously completed
an

degree programme with

We value the strength of our alumni network and the trust our graduates place in the programme. New participants referred by an IMBA alumni or current IMBA participant are eligible for a one-time grant of $5,000 off tuition fees (before prevailing GST). This grant applies strictly to tuition fees and does not cover other programme-related costs.
The referrer will be required to complete a recommendation report to confirm the relationship

The applicants have previously completed an undergraduate or postgraduate degree programme with the following Singaporeâ€™s autonomous universities:Â National University of Singapore (NUS), Singapore Management University (SMU), Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS), Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD), or Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) are eligible for this grant.

Lifelong Learning Subsidy for Singaporeans, and PRs
To encourage lifelong learning and make postgraduate education more accessible, we offer a SGD 5,000 subsidy to all Singaporeans and Permanent Residents (PRs) applying for the IMBA intake in AY2026.
Corporate Subsidy
We encourage prospective candidates to engage their organisations early to explore support optionsâ€”whether in the form of full or partial sponsorship, or flexible work arrangements during your studies.Â Preferential corporate rate may apply for applicants admitted with corporate support. To learn more, contact us for a personalised consultation.

Grants/discounts/subsidy/ stipend support are deducted equally across 4 instalments;
Scholarships are deducted in the last instalment and awardees need to fulfil GPA requirement;
Students can apply for maximum 2 forms of financial support;

cannot be more than 20%
of the programme fee.

overseas-immersion-segment.content:
The International MBA (IMBA) programme distinguishes itself with its
Overseas Immersion Segments
, a transformative learning journey where students engage directly with global leaders, top corporations, and cutting-edge research institutions.
This experience equips students with real-world insights, leadership perspectives, and industry connections that extend far beyond the classroom.
Amazon Web Services (AWS): Learning Innovation from Top Industry Players
At the
AWS Asia Pacific Hub
, International MBA students gain unparalleled access to the worldâ€™s leading cloud solutions provider, a privilege made possible through NTUâ€™s global reputation and strong corporate connections.
Few institutions can open doors at this level, but NTU ensures its students engage directly with leaders shaping the future of business and technology.
By engaging with these leaders, students donâ€™t just study innovation, they witness it in practice, learn how it is embedded into corporate culture, and develop the mindset to translate an
innovation-first approach
into their own leadership journey.
Sandesh Menon, Head of ASEAN Enterprise Greenfield Business
Shares how AWS differentiates itself in a highly competitive market, giving students a clear view of what sets world-class companies apart
Harley Young, Head of Technology
Introduces Amazonâ€™s distinctive culture and leadership principles, revealing how they drive high-performing teams and effective decision-making at scale
Girish Dilip, Head of Generative AI Technology
Provides insight into how technological acumen, AI innovation, and digital transformation are redefining competitive advantage in the global economy
CyberSG R&D Programme Office (CRPO): Cybersecurity Research and Innovation
The CRPO is a national centre at NTU that aims to propel Singapore to the forefront of cybersecurity innovation and implementation, backed by S$62 million in funding from the Cyber Security Agency of Singapore (CSA).
Cybersecurity research and innovation are vital to a digital economy because they protect critical infrastructure and business operations from cyber threats, foster trust in digital services, and enable safe technological advancement.
The International MBA students get to experience this
critical pillar
of a
thriving digital economy
through a sharing and visit to one of the national labs, iTrust, SUTD, arranged by the CRPO.
Dr Chia Chien Wei, Chief-of-Staff CRPO, NTU
Provides insight into cybersecurity research and innovation initiatives and NTUâ€™s strategic role in CyberSG
The International MBA students being briefed on one of the several world-class testbeds and training platforms hosted by iTrust. These testbeds and training platforms together constitute a one-of-a kind facility for research and training in the design of safe and secure large-scale cyber-physical systems
Fireside Chat: Sustainability in the Green and Digital Economy
During the Fireside Chat, IMBA students had the opportunity to hear directly from top leaders in their fields to provide an unparalleled way to understand how to think strategically, make decisions, and drive business growth with a focus on sustainability in the green and digital economy.
The session concluded with an
exclusive networking dinner
, where students could continue conversations with speakers, alumni, and peers transforming insights into meaningful connections.
This unique experience is made possible only through
NTUâ€™s strong reputation and its connections to industry leaders at the highest level.
Lam Sheau Kai, President of SMRT Trains
Titus Yong, CEO of SPTel
Kenneth Tan, Deputy Executive Director of Octave Institute.
Porsche Studio Asia Pacific: Branding and Customer Experience
An inside look at
Porsche Asia Pacific
gives International MBA students an exclusive opportunity to experience how one of the worldâ€™s most iconic luxury brands sustains its leadership.
At
Porsche Studio Singapore
, students gain a powerful lesson in
strategy, storytelling, and customer experience
, seeing firsthand how a legendary brand translates vision into long-term success.
Hannes Ruoff, CEO of Porsche Asia Pacific
Delivers an inspiring presentation on how Porsche drives sustainable growth in highly competitive markets like Singapore while preserving its brand identity
Brendan Mok, Head of PR & Communications
Brings brand philosophy to life through tours, curated experiences, and storytelling that show how Porsche designs customer journeys built on emotion and loyalty
Hereâ€™s what Porsche Asia Pacific Pte Ltd shared about our visit:
"We welcomed students from NTU's International MBA programme in Vietnam to explore how Porsche continues to redefine the future of automotive retail, while still staying true to its rich heritage and spirit of forward-looking innovation. Just like how our founder Ferry Porsche forged his own vision to create a dream sports car, we look forward to the value these leaders will create tomorrow."
Building Connections Beyond the Classroom
The IMBA journey is not only about learning from world-class faculty and industry leaders, but also about
forging meaningful connections with peers who share the same drive and mindset
.
One highlight was a BBQ party generously hosted by an IMBA student, where classmates, professors and friends came together in a warm and informal setting.
Over good food and music, we drank, sang, laughed, and shared stories. These moments of joy and deep conversation created memories that go beyond the classroom. They offered fresh perspectives, helping us
reshape our thinking and broaden our worldview.
This is the essence of the IMBA experience:
a community that grows, learns and celebrates together.
What do our students say?
For many, the Overseas Immersion was not just about classes or company visits, it was a moment of discovery. Students came back with new ideas, deeper friendships, and memories that will last a lifetime. Hereâ€™s what IMBA students shared about their experience, in their own words:
